title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: When using the New Package Wizard, a confusing message appears at the top saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even if the package name field is empty. This message needs clarification.
EB: When opening the New Java Package Wizard, if the package name field is empty, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear. Additionally, the message should provide more context or guidance on how to create a default package.
SR:
1. Remove the warning message when the package name field is empty
2. Add more explanatory context or guidance on how to create a default package
